Author: Adalbert_Stifter
Title: [ANN][ICO] PAYSURA - International PayReward Coin (IPC)
Body: Will the PAYSURA solution require any hardware for the merchant or is it all software based? Is there an integration with POS devices or will everything work through an app / smartphone (from the merchant's perspective)?  Thanks Adalbert

Author: PAYSURA
Title: [ANN][ICO] PAYSURA - International PayReward Coin (IPC)
Body: Hello Adalbert,  PAYSURA intends to offer a software as a service in all propability on a subscription bases. PAYSURA will offer API (already accessible via our Github page) through which merchants can easily connect to the PAYSURA system.   From a merchant perspective there will be no hardware and no specific POS device be needed.  Best regards  PAYSURA

Title: [ANN][ICO] PAYSURA - International PayReward Coin (IPC)
Body: Hello haskellCoder42,  the IPC tokens that are exchanged via ETH are distributed automatically after a contribution is made during the crwodsale. IPC that are exchanged via BTC and LTC will be distributed after the crowdsale has ended.  All IPC can not be transferred during the crowdsale.  Best regards  PAYSURA

Author: PAYSURA
Title: [ANN][ICO] PAYSURA - International PayReward Coin (IPC)

Author: haskellCoder42
Title: [ANN][ICO] PAYSURA - International PayReward Coin (IPC)
Body: SInce u have mined some blocks it means it's already developed? Or is ur dev team still developing?  I think you're the only reward based project with focus on an own blockchain, I hope it was a good decision to invest in ur reward project and not others like bitrewards or any other which depends on ethereum txcosts.

Author: PAYSURA
Title: [ANN][ICO] PAYSURA - International PayReward Coin (IPC)
Body: Hello haskellCoder42,  our development team is still developing and it will definitely take several months and lots of further adjustments before our own blockchain can go live.  To this date the IPC is still a ERC20 token on the Ethereum Blockchain and although the IPC covers security aspects that most others dont the current technology base doesnt differ to similar project such as bitrewards. What is special about us is that in comparison to bitrewards etc our project offers a more reward oriented and specified blockchain future. This will allow us to offer a blockchain that perfectly fits the needs of a reward system and the processes within. Moreover an own blockchain will help us to increase our degree of flexibility regarding further features and adjustment that might be beneficiary but not possible through the Ethereum Blockchain.   Best regards  PAYSURA

Author: PAYSURA
Title: [ANN][ICO] PAYSURA - International PayReward Coin (IPC)
Body: Hello idioma1,  we are intending to provide a blockchain based loyalty/reward system starting in germany with the bigger goal to introduce our own blockchain specifially designed for loyalty program requirements such as transaction speed, low transaction costs and a customizable add on that allows every major merchant to design its reward program individually. Until our own blockchain can go live PAYSURA works on the Ethereum Blockchain.  The main component of our system that will be offered as a service is the IPC (InternationalPayReward Coin). At the moment we are running our ICO which will end April 2nd (participation only via our official website https://paysura.com/ )  Feel free to ask further questions!  Best regards  PAYSURA

Author: PAYSURA
Title: [ANN][ICO] PAYSURA - International PayReward Coin (IPC)
Body: Hi CryptoX187,  thanks for your questions and your interest in PAYSURA and the IPC.  1.) In order to choose the right ERC standard our team has considered the most relevant ERC standards, which include ERC20, ERC223, ERC721 and others. Each of them has its pros and cons. The team decided to use the ERC20 standard for several reasons. Currently ERC223 is more like a proposal than a standard and the proposal discussion is still ongoing thereby bringing many risks like security issues, its undecided signature or uncompatibility to other smart contracts. Transfering ERC223 tokens to contracts creates a named function on that contract but since that function's name is currently undecided it is not possible to write such a contract and we would have to wait for the final standard to be defined.  Furthermore it will cause problems for multi-sig wallets and contracts that have not implemented the tokenFallback function which depends on blind token transfers to contracts. The ERC223 has less applications for the token holder due to its lack of compatibility to some current smart contracts (e.g. token exchange contracts).  The main goal of ERC223 is to prevent sending tokens to contracts that do not expect ERC223 tokens and enable token deposit from contracts by creating only one transaction. Lost tokens are most likely stuck in the token contract itself since many token holders accidentally confuse the target address with token contract address. Unlike most others the ERC20 token,  the (IPC token) contract protects the user from this mistake by not accepting ipc tokens from anyone and therefore making the mentioned transactions unsuccesful.  Additionally the contract will provide the approveAndCall function which makes it possible to enable token exchanges within one transaction instead of two (cost effective).  2.) Our team is considering bounty programs but has not yet decided whether or not and how exactly the PAYSURA bounty program should/ can look like. In the case of a decision pro bounty program PAYSURA will communicate it via Website and all relevant channels.  3.) Due to the blockchain fundamentals scalability (international and global) is given at any time. Nonetheless PAYSURA intends to start in the German e-commerce market at first by expanding to other countries as soon as possible.  We hope that we could answer your questions but feel free to get back to us in case of any further uncertainties.  Kind regards  PAYSURA

Title: [ANN][ICO] PAYSURA - International PayReward Coin (IPC)
Body: Hello Glundung,  thanks for your message!  In terms of Pre-ICO you can register for the ICOs first bonus round via our whitelist which means a 35% discount. Best Regards  PAYSURA

Author: Andeze17
Title: [ANN][ICO] PAYSURA - International PayReward Coin (IPC)
Body: There are a lot of reward program ICOs recently - is there any key differences or advantages that Paysura has or intends to have over them?

Author: PAYSURA
Title: [ANN][ICO] PAYSURA - International PayReward Coin (IPC)
Body: A small copy/paste from a previous similar question:  "[...] the PAYSURA reward pool will be structured in different units. Merchants can register for an own unit and offer products or services for IPC. Also will be a unit reserved for our community where the community can vote for products or services they would like to exchange for IPC. These products will be community driven and also offered in the pool. Through this different units PAYSURA will manage the whole infrastructure of the reward pool without any big issues in IT Infrastructure on merchant-side. Hence this it will be possible to offer useful products and services for IPC in the PAYSURA reward pool."  We want to offer products that are useful and needed and community driven. We want to bring a more advantage to the usual customer and offern such products.  Through the "units" in the reward pool it will be possible to offer reward wordwide. In the first stage we have to start in one region but we will move on very fast. Our expansion plan is being prepared and will be communicated after the crowdsale.

Author: PAYSURA
Title: [ANN][ICO] PAYSURA - International PayReward Coin (IPC)
Body: Hi,  thanks for your interest on PAYSURA and your question. THe PAYSURA Team is based in Germany and hence our team is facing all kind of reward programs in Germany. That is why it was possible for us to figure out all kind of problems that traditional loyalty programs and current blockchain based reward systems are facing.  Here is a summary of the advantages of PAYSURA solving these problems:  PAYSURA is providing the reward pool. Every merchant and also our community will have the opportunity to use a unit in the reward pool without having any development know how, without caring of any security issues. It will be all developed by PAYSURA so that many costs on merchants side can be safed  The whole infrastructure and the algorithm for calculating the reward will be self-regulated and hosted by PAYSURA. In Germany it is a big issue that customer data is often sold or shared. PAYSURA will not sell customer data to third parties. PAYSURA will not track any customer behavior or have any influence on it. It will be possible to collect IPC for products but also services like car sharing or insurances and many more  PAYSURA is a full community oriented project hence PAYSURA is reserving 85 % (!) of IPC for the community and only 10 % of IPC will be for the Dev-Team. 5 % of IPC will be for advisory and investment purpose.  For more information, feel free to ask.

Body: - Will it be possible to buy the products without IPC? - How large do you expect the product pool to be? Any definition yet how many items will be listed? - Are you still in plan with the schedule? Do we have to expect any changes to the roadmap yet?  thanks in advance for answering the questions.  Adalbert

Author: PAYSURA
Title: [ANN][ICO] PAYSURA - International PayReward Coin (IPC)
Body: Hi,  there will be different units. Units for merchants but also a unit in the reward pool reserved for the community. Here we will organize different kind of votings where products can be suggested and afterwards voted by every user. There will be similar voting procedures to build a community-driven reward pool.

Author: PAYSURA
Title: [ANN][ICO] PAYSURA - International PayReward Coin (IPC)
Body: Hi Adalbert,  thanks for your questions.  1. The products will be offered by merchants with different payment methods. The products and services offered in the Reward-Pool can only be bought through the reward coin (IPC). 2. As in our whitepaper mentioned we will use 30% of the funded amount during the ICO to offer products and services in the reward pool. Afterwards the reward pool will grow day by day. Our target is to offer products and services that are useful for every customer. 3. Yes, we are working really hard in the background and the next steps of the roadmap will be pusblihed soon (before the start of the crowdsale)  Kind Regards,  PAYSURA

Author: PAYSURA
Title: [ANN][ICO] PAYSURA - International PayReward Coin (IPC)
Body: Dear Community,  We are PAYSURA, a Frankfurt, Germany based project that aims to change reward, loyalty and cashback programs for the better.  PAYSURA is providing the International PayReward Coin (IPC) as an enabler for a worldwide uniform reward system that applies the advantages of the Blockchain Technology thereby revolutionizing the reward systems landscape. The IPC will be used to reward customers for buying products or services. IPC will be collectable through different channels and options such as online platforms, the crypto market in general as well as all partners offering reward in form of the IPC. All IPC can be used in a reward-pool to exchange them against reward products or services.  Crowdsale starting on 03.03.2018      Current Project Status:  Whitepaper online OnePager in different languages Introductory Video of the International PayReward Coin (IPC) on YouTube and on the PAYSURA website Self-Regulated Reward Algorithm (ongoing) Rest Interfaces to the PAYSURA reward algorithm (ongoing) Spring Boot Backend, REST Communication, Neo4J GraphDatabase configured. RewardPool Backend (ongoing). SmartContract for IPC ERC-20-Token already on the blockchain and available on Etherscan.io IPC Report in Progress. A report to show how the IPC token was developed and which security aspects are included     OnePager in the following languages available:  OnePager: https://paysura.com/one-pager/  English German Japanese Chinese Korean Spanish Russian General Information:  Website: https://www.paysura.com  Whitepaper: https://paysura.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/02/Whitepaper_IPC.pdf  Crowdsale: https://www.paysura.com  OnePager: https://paysura.com/one-pager/  GiHub: https://github.com/PAYSURA  Telegram: https://t.me/PAYSURA  Subreddit: https://www.reddit.com/r/IntPayRewardCoin/  Twitter: https://twitter.com/PAYSURA_IPC  Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/paysura_ipc/  Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/PAYSURA  YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mFBdux9HB7M&t=4s   International PayReward Coin (IPC) - Token Distribution:   Total IPC: 440 000 000 IPC IPC for crowdsale: 264 000 000 IPC IPC reserved for reward: 110 000 000 IPC IPC for Dev: 44 000 000 IPC IPC for Advisor: 22 000 000 IPC  In total 85 % of the IPC will be distributed to the community. 10 % will be for Dev and 5 % of the IPC will be for Advisors and Investors.  Token Sale:  First Day Special Offer (only Whitelist): 1 IPC = $ 0,12 Bonus #2: 1 IPC = $ 0, 14 Bonus #3: 1 IPC = $ 0, 16 Final Sale: 1 IPC = $ 0, 18  Join the whitelist to be a part of the special offer: https://paysura.com/  The ETH rate for the IPC will be communicated five days before the crowdsale starts.  Our Team:  We are a team based in Frankfurt, Germany consisting of Computer Scientists, Business Administrators, IT Consultants and a Finance and Accounting Specialist. In addition to that we are supported by highly qualified advisors with different relevant backgrounds. All members of the PAYSURA team are passionate about the Blockchain Technology, its use cases and especially the cryptocurrency market and its implications for the financial and economic system since the early stages.    Additionally we have two more Software Developer in the PAYSURA Team and one more will join the PAYSURA Team in February 2018. For more details such as all team members profiles please visit our official website:   https://www.paysura.com .[/list][/list][/list]

Author: haskellCoder42

Body: I have read your whitepaper, your reward pool made me curious. How will your reward pool be structured and what kind of products will be offered in it??

Author: PAYSURA
Title: [ANN][ICO] PAYSURA - International PayReward Coin (IPC)
Body: Hi,  the PAYSURA reward pool will be structured in different units. Merchants can register for an own unit and offer products or services for IPC. Also will be a unit reserved for our community where the community can vote for products or services they would like to exchange for IPC. These products will be community driven and also offered in the pool. Through this different units PAYSURA will manage the whole infrastructure of the reward pool without any big issues in IT Infrastructure on merchant-side. Hence this it will be possible to offer useful products and services for IPC in the PAYSURA reward pool.

Author: cryptaxo
Title: [ANN][ICO] PAYSURA - International PayReward Coin (IPC)
Body: why do a token is called a coin, is there plan to start a coin?  would that be mineable? shouldn't it be International PayReward Tokens (IPT)?

Author: PAYSURA
Title: [ANN][ICO] PAYSURA - International PayReward Coin (IPC)
Body: Hi Cryptaxo,  thanks for your question. We believe that the best way of using a blockchain for a specific purpose is to have an own blockchain. Through that it is possible to do an optimised development with the correct focus. So, there is a bigger long term plan of PAYSURA hence we called it International PayReward Coin(IPC) and not International PayReward Token.
